title: Chapter 2 Error control | Improving Your Statistical Inferences

last_post.content: If you repeatedly perform a hypothesis test when the null hypothesis is true, p-values will randomly drift between 0 and 1, and therefore, if you test often enough, you will always find a significant effect. https://lakens.github.io/statistical_inferences/errorcontrol.html#optionalstopping This is why preregistration is important. Since I just saw yet another developer use '1.2.3.4' in an example configuration, a reminder that you MUST NOT use publicly routable addresses that you do not control in your code.

Instead, use one of the available 'TEST-NET' IPv4 or IPv6 ranges documented in RFC 6890, such as;

192.0.2.0/24
198.51.100.0/24
203.0.113.0/24

❌ 1.2.3.4
✅ 192.0.2.4

Pass it on to all of your fellow developers, documentation writers, and so forth.

Full RFC is here;

https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/rfc6890/

title: A geometrical connection between sparse and low-rank matrices and...

last_post.content:
A connection between sparse and low rank matrices. Let S be a sparse similarity matrix, for example the distances of the 3 nearest neighbours in a low dimensional manifold. Can you recover S if you have a low rank (dense) matrix L from in a high dimensional space? This paper provides a geometric interpretation for S = max(0,L). It proposes a decomposition algorithm, that can be modelled as a ReLU neural network layer.

#MachineLearning #SparseDecomposition #LowRank #TMLR

title: Google wage fixing, 11-CV-02509-LHK, ORDER DENYING PLAINTIFFS' MOTION FOR PRELIMINARY APPROVAL OF SETTLEMENTS WITH ADOBE, APPLE, GOOGLE, AND INTEL

last_post.content:
It seems like other factors totally dominated the returns to deep knowledge. For programming, I think it's arbitrary and path dependent.

Comp was heavily suppressed during the Google-Apple wage fixing agreement era (https://danluu.com/google-wage-fixing/), when the agreement spread to basically every major tech co except FB.

When the agreement was cancelled, FB's aggressive offers raised comp across the industry, but that seems quite arbitrary, in that FB didn't have to pay people so well or even exist.

@hannah [huge knuckle crack] okay so... I want something that looks a lot like Microsoft Ambrosia https://microsoft.github.io/AMBROSIA/ but integrates virtual resilience to the surface syntax level. Maybe you do async/sync function coloring, maybe it's entirely opaque to the user.

Users should be able to easily write highly expressive programs that can be replicated, relocated, snapshotted, scheduled/resumed and ideally connected to with a REPL and edited ~live. Performance noncritical. Durability uber alles

title: Programmer salaries in the age of LLMs

last_post.content:
On the backwards looking part of this quote in https://milkyeggs.com/?p=303, that returns to factual knowledge have been decreasing since databases were created, is that true?

It sounds plausible and yet, it seems untrue w.r.t. deep knowledge in programming, e.g., the median FAANG-ish programmer with deep knowledge of the kernel is a staff eng earning $500k/yr (with plenty taking home $1M+).

Real earnings for programmers with many kinds of deep knowledge increased rapidly over the past 2 decades.

"The Disappearance of the Ashtray"

When I was a kid in the 70s and early 80s, you were essentially *never* in a room that didn't have at least one -- and usually multiple -- ashtrays

Some of them were pieces of *furniture*. Many were gorgeously designed!

Now when I show one to my kids, they have no idea what this strange artifact could be

My essay, for Medium subscribers: https://medium.com/@clivethompson/the-disappearance-of-the-ashtray-4badc1be9e3b

title: Does Your Local Museum or University Still Have Native American Remains?

last_post.content:
Does Your Local Museum or University Still Have Native American Remains?
---
In 1990, Congress passed the Native American Graves Protection & #Repatriation Act (NAGPRA), which set up a process for tribes to request the return of remains.

33 years later, at least half of the remains of more than 210,000 #NativeAmericans have yet to be returned.

Use this tool to see which #museums, #colleges & govt. agencies still have them:

https://projects.propublica.org/repatriation-nagpra-database/?utm_medium=social&utm_source=mastodon&utm_campaign=mastodon-post

title: Alarmed by A.I. Chatbots, Universities Start Revamping How They Teach

last_post.content:
To me, the framing of the discussion in this story is misguided. So-called #AI like #ChatGPT is not a reason to ban AI from #academia nor institute draconian proctoring practices. A better response, radical though it may seem, would be to (gasp) actually *get to know your students as individuals.*

This issue here isn’t #plagiarism or AI; the issue is brittle educational systems whose founding assumptions and incentives are threatened by new tools.

The yearly ritual of twisting Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.'s words to defend the status quo is in full swing on #MLKday.

One place it's especially obvious: the Bangor Daily News reprinted #MLK's speech.

But quietly toned it down.

Took out the *inconvenient* bits.

Folks noticed & called it out.

So I decided to do a text compare.

Look closely at what was removed.

The full, original speech is here:

Celebrate the holiday by reading something he wrote or spoke, in full, and considering the power of his words and actions.
